00037 static int bmw_mask_check_vert(BMWalker *walker, BMVert *v)
00038 {
00039     if ((walker->flag & BMW_FLAG_TEST_HIDDEN) && BM_elem_flag_test(v, BM_ELEM_HIDDEN)) {
00040         return FALSE;
00041     }
00042     else if (walker->mask_vert && !BMO_elem_flag_test(walker->bm, v, walker->mask_vert)) {
00043         return FALSE;
00044     }
00045     else {
00046         return TRUE;
00047     }
00048 }
00049 
00050 static int bmw_mask_check_edge(BMWalker *walker, BMEdge *e)
00051 {
00052     if ((walker->flag & BMW_FLAG_TEST_HIDDEN) && BM_elem_flag_test(e, BM_ELEM_HIDDEN)) {
00053         return FALSE;
00054     }
00055     else if (walker->mask_edge && !BMO_elem_flag_test(walker->bm, e, walker->mask_edge)) {
00056         return FALSE;
00057     }
00058     else {
00059         return TRUE;
00060     }
00061 }
00062 
00063 static int bmw_mask_check_face(BMWalker *walker, BMFace *f)
00064 {
00065     if ((walker->flag & BMW_FLAG_TEST_HIDDEN) && BM_elem_flag_test(f, BM_ELEM_HIDDEN)) {
00066         return FALSE;
00067     }
00068     else if (walker->mask_face && !BMO_elem_flag_test(walker->bm, f, walker->mask_face)) {
00069         return FALSE;
00070     }
00071     else {
00072         return TRUE;
00073     }
00074 }

00084 static void bmw_ShellWalker_visitEdge(BMWalker *walker, BMEdge *e)
00085 {
00086     BMwShellWalker *shellWalk = NULL;
00087 
00088     if (BLI_ghash_haskey(walker->visithash, e)) {
00089         return;
00090     }
00091 
00092     if (!bmw_mask_check_edge(walker, e)) {
00093         return;
00094     }
00095 
00096     shellWalk = BMW_state_add(walker);
00097     shellWalk->curedge = e;
00098     BLI_ghash_insert(walker->visithash, e, NULL);
00099 }
00100 
00101 static void bmw_ShellWalker_begin(BMWalker *walker, void *data)
00102 {
00103     BMIter eiter;
00104     BMHeader *h = data;
00105     BMEdge *e;
00106     BMVert *v;
00107 
00108     if (UNLIKELY(h == NULL)) {
00109         return;
00110     }
00111 
00112     switch (h->htype) {
00113         case BM_VERT:
00114         {
00115             /* starting the walk at a vert, add all the edges
00116              * to the worklist */
00117             v = (BMVert *)h;
00118             BM_ITER_ELEM (e, &eiter, v, BM_EDGES_OF_VERT) {
00119                 bmw_ShellWalker_visitEdge(walker, e);
00120             }
00121             break;
00122         }
00123 
00124         case BM_EDGE:
00125         {
00126             /* starting the walk at an edge, add the single edge
00127              * to the worklist */
00128             e = (BMEdge *)h;
00129             bmw_ShellWalker_visitEdge(walker, e);
00130             break;
00131         }
00132     }
00133 }
00134 
00135 static void *bmw_ShellWalker_yield(BMWalker *walker)
00136 {
00137     BMwShellWalker *shellWalk = BMW_current_state(walker);
00138     return shellWalk->curedge;
00139 }
00140 
00141 static void *bmw_ShellWalker_step(BMWalker *walker)
00142 {
00143     BMwShellWalker *swalk = BMW_current_state(walker);
00144     BMEdge *e, *e2;
00145     BMVert *v;
00146     BMIter iter;
00147     int i;
00148 
00149     e = swalk->curedge;
00150     BMW_state_remove(walker);
00151 
00152     for (i = 0; i < 2; i++) {
00153         v = i ? e->v2 : e->v1;
00154         BM_ITER_ELEM (e2, &iter, v, BM_EDGES_OF_VERT) {
00155             bmw_ShellWalker_visitEdge(walker, e2);
00156         }
00157     }
00158 
00159     return e;
00160 }

00210 static void bmw_ConnectedVertexWalker_visitVertex(BMWalker *walker, BMVert *v)
00211 {
00212     BMwConnectedVertexWalker *vwalk;
00213 
00214     if (BLI_ghash_haskey(walker->visithash, v)) {
00215         /* already visited */
00216         return;
00217     }
00218 
00219     if (!bmw_mask_check_vert(walker, v)) {
00220         /* not flagged for walk */
00221         return;
00222     }
00223 
00224     vwalk = BMW_state_add(walker);
00225     vwalk->curvert = v;
00226     BLI_ghash_insert(walker->visithash, v, NULL);
00227 }
00228 
00229 static void bmw_ConnectedVertexWalker_begin(BMWalker *walker, void *data)
00230 {
00231     BMVert *v = data;
00232     bmw_ConnectedVertexWalker_visitVertex(walker, v);
00233 }
00234 
00235 static void *bmw_ConnectedVertexWalker_yield(BMWalker *walker)
00236 {
00237     BMwConnectedVertexWalker *vwalk = BMW_current_state(walker);
00238     return vwalk->curvert;
00239 }

00241 static void *bmw_ConnectedVertexWalker_step(BMWalker *walker)
00242 {
00243     BMwConnectedVertexWalker *vwalk = BMW_current_state(walker);
00244     BMVert *v, *v2;
00245     BMEdge *e;
00246     BMIter iter;
00247 
00248     v = vwalk->curvert;
00249 
00250     BMW_state_remove(walker);
00251 
00252     BM_ITER_ELEM (e, &iter, v, BM_EDGES_OF_VERT) {
00253         v2 = BM_edge_other_vert(e, v);
00254         if (!BLI_ghash_haskey(walker->visithash, v2)) {
00255             bmw_ConnectedVertexWalker_visitVertex(walker, v2);
00256         }
00257     }
00258 
00259     return v;
00260 }

00270 {
00271     BMLoop *l = data;
00272     BMwIslandboundWalker *iwalk = NULL;
00273 
00274     iwalk = BMW_state_add(walker);
00275 
00276     iwalk->base = iwalk->curloop = l;
00277     iwalk->lastv = l->v;
00278 
00279     BLI_ghash_insert(walker->visithash, data, NULL);

00281 }

00290 static void *bmw_IslandboundWalker_step(BMWalker *walker)
00291 {
00292     BMwIslandboundWalker *iwalk = BMW_current_state(walker), owalk;
00293     BMVert *v;
00294     BMEdge *e = iwalk->curloop->e;
00295     BMFace *f;
00296     BMLoop *l = iwalk->curloop;
00297     /* int found = 0; */
00298 
00299     owalk = *iwalk;
00300 
00301     v = BM_edge_other_vert(e, iwalk->lastv);
00302 
00303     if (!BM_vert_is_manifold(v)) {
00304         BMW_reset(walker);
00305         BMO_error_raise(walker->bm, NULL, BMERR_WALKER_FAILED,
00306                         "Non-manifold vert "
00307                         "while searching region boundary");
00308         return NULL;
00309     }
00310     
00311     /* pop off current stat */
00312     BMW_state_remove(walker);
00313     
00314     f = l->f;
00315     
00316     while (1) {
00317         l = BM_face_other_edge_loop(f, e, v);
00318         if (l != l->radial_next) {
00319             l = l->radial_next;
00320             f = l->f;
00321             e = l->e;
00322 
00323             if (!bmw_mask_check_face(walker, f)) {
00324                 l = l->radial_next;
00325                 break;
00326             }
00327         }
00328         else {
00329             f = l->f;
00330             e = l->e;
00331             break;
00332         }
00333     }
00334     
00335     if (l == owalk.curloop) {
00336         return NULL;
00337     }
00338     else if (BLI_ghash_haskey(walker->visithash, l)) {
00339         return owalk.curloop;
00340     }
00341 
00342     BLI_ghash_insert(walker->visithash, l, NULL);
00343     iwalk = BMW_state_add(walker);
00344     iwalk->base = owalk.base;
00345 
00346     //if (!BMO_elem_flag_test(walker->bm, l->f, walker->restrictflag))
00347     //  iwalk->curloop = l->radial_next;
00348     iwalk->curloop = l; //else iwalk->curloop = l;
00349     iwalk->lastv = v;
00350 
00351     return owalk.curloop;
00352 }

00362 static void bmw_IslandWalker_begin(BMWalker *walker, void *data)
00363 {
00364     BMwIslandWalker *iwalk = NULL;
00365 
00366     if (!bmw_mask_check_face(walker, data)) {
00367         return;
00368     }
00369 
00370     iwalk = BMW_state_add(walker);
00371     BLI_ghash_insert(walker->visithash, data, NULL);
00372 
00373     iwalk->cur = data;
00374 }

00382 
00383 static void *bmw_IslandWalker_step(BMWalker *walker)
00384 {
00385     BMwIslandWalker *iwalk = BMW_current_state(walker);
00386     /* BMwIslandWalker *owalk = iwalk; */ /* UNUSED */
00387     BMIter iter, liter;
00388     BMFace *f, *curf = iwalk->cur;
00389     BMLoop *l;
00390     
00391     BMW_state_remove(walker);
00392 
00393     l = BM_iter_new(&liter, walker->bm, BM_LOOPS_OF_FACE, iwalk->cur);
00394     for ( ; l; l = BM_iter_step(&liter)) {
00395         /* could skip loop here too, but don't add unless we need it */
00396         if (!bmw_mask_check_edge(walker, l->e)) {
00397             continue;
00398         }
00399 
00400         f = BM_iter_new(&iter, walker->bm, BM_FACES_OF_EDGE, l->e);
00401         for ( ; f; f = BM_iter_step(&iter)) {
00402 
00403             if (!bmw_mask_check_face(walker, f)) {
00404                 continue;
00405             }
00406 
00407             if (BLI_ghash_haskey(walker->visithash, f)) {
00408                 continue;
00409             }
00410             
00411             iwalk = BMW_state_add(walker);
00412             iwalk->cur = f;
00413             BLI_ghash_insert(walker->visithash, f, NULL);
00414             break;
00415         }
00416     }
00417     
00418     return curf;
00419 }

00427 static void bmw_LoopWalker_begin(BMWalker *walker, void *data)
00428 {
00429     BMwLoopWalker *lwalk = NULL, owalk;
00430     BMEdge *e = data;
00431     BMVert *v;
00432     int vert_edge_count[2] = {BM_vert_edge_count_nonwire(e->v1),
00433                               BM_vert_edge_count_nonwire(e->v2)};
00434 
00435     v = e->v1;
00436 
00437     lwalk = BMW_state_add(walker);
00438     BLI_ghash_insert(walker->visithash, e, NULL);
00439 
00440     lwalk->cur = lwalk->start = e;
00441     lwalk->lastv = lwalk->startv = v;
00442     lwalk->is_boundary = BM_edge_is_boundary(e);
00443     lwalk->is_single = (vert_edge_count[0] == 2 && vert_edge_count[1] == 2);
00444 
00445     /* could also check that vertex*/
00446     if ((lwalk->is_boundary == FALSE) &&
00447         (vert_edge_count[0] == 3 || vert_edge_count[1] == 3))
00448     {
00449         BMIter iter;
00450         BMFace *f_iter;
00451         BMFace *f_best = NULL;
00452 
00453         BM_ITER_ELEM (f_iter, &iter, e, BM_FACES_OF_EDGE) {
00454             if (f_best == NULL || f_best->len < f_iter->len) {
00455                 f_best = f_iter;
00456             }
00457         }
00458 
00459         if (f_best) {
00460             /* only use hub selection for 5+ sides else this could
00461              * conflict with normal edge loop selection. */
00462             lwalk->f_hub = f_best->len > 4 ? f_best : NULL;
00463         }
00464         else {
00465             /* edge doesn't have any faces connected to it */
00466             lwalk->f_hub = NULL;
00467         }
00468     }
00469     else {
00470         lwalk->f_hub = NULL;
00471     }
00472 
00473     /* rewind */
00474     while (BMW_current_state(walker)) {
00475         owalk = *((BMwLoopWalker *)BMW_current_state(walker));
00476         BMW_walk(walker);
00477     }
00478 
00479     lwalk = BMW_state_add(walker);
00480     *lwalk = owalk;
00481 
00482     lwalk->lastv = lwalk->startv = BM_edge_other_vert(owalk.cur, lwalk->lastv);
00483 
00484     BLI_ghash_free(walker->visithash, NULL, NULL);
00485     walker->visithash = BLI_ghash_new(BLI_ghashutil_ptrhash, BLI_ghashutil_ptrcmp, "bmesh walkers 2");
00486     BLI_ghash_insert(walker->visithash, owalk.cur, NULL);
00487 }

00489 static void *bmw_LoopWalker_yield(BMWalker *walker)
00490 {
00491     BMwLoopWalker *lwalk = BMW_current_state(walker);
00492 
00493     return lwalk->cur;
00494 }
00495 
00496 static void *bmw_LoopWalker_step(BMWalker *walker)
00497 {
00498     BMwLoopWalker *lwalk = BMW_current_state(walker), owalk;
00499     BMEdge *e = lwalk->cur, *nexte = NULL;
00500     BMLoop *l;
00501     BMVert *v;
00502     int i;
00503 
00504     owalk = *lwalk;
00505     BMW_state_remove(walker);
00506 
00507     l = e->l;
00508 
00509     if (owalk.f_hub) { /* NGON EDGE */
00510         int vert_edge_tot;
00511 
00512         v = BM_edge_other_vert(e, lwalk->lastv);
00513 
00514         vert_edge_tot = BM_vert_edge_count_nonwire(v);
00515 
00516         if (vert_edge_tot == 3) {
00517             l = BM_face_other_vert_loop(owalk.f_hub, lwalk->lastv, v);
00518             nexte = BM_edge_exists(v, l->v);
00519 
00520             if (bmw_mask_check_edge(walker, nexte) &&
00521                 !BLI_ghash_haskey(walker->visithash, nexte))
00522             {
00523                 lwalk = BMW_state_add(walker);
00524                 lwalk->cur = nexte;
00525                 lwalk->lastv = v;
00526 
00527                 lwalk->is_boundary = owalk.is_boundary;
00528                 lwalk->is_single = owalk.is_single;
00529                 lwalk->f_hub = owalk.f_hub;
00530 
00531                 BLI_ghash_insert(walker->visithash, nexte, NULL);
00532             }
00533         }
00534     }
00535     else if (l) { /* NORMAL EDGE WITH FACES */
00536         int vert_edge_tot;
00537         int stopi;
00538 
00539         v = BM_edge_other_vert(e, lwalk->lastv);
00540 
00541         vert_edge_tot = BM_vert_edge_count_nonwire(v);
00542 
00543         if (/* check if we should step, this is fairly involved */
00544 
00545             /* typical loopiong over edges in the middle of a mesh */
00546             /* however, why use 2 here at all? I guess for internal ngon loops it can be useful. Antony R. */
00547             ((vert_edge_tot == 4 || vert_edge_tot == 2) && owalk.is_boundary == FALSE) ||
00548 
00549             /* walk over boundary of faces but stop at corners */
00550             (owalk.is_boundary == TRUE && owalk.is_single  == FALSE && vert_edge_tot > 2) ||
00551 
00552             /* initial edge was a boundary, so is this edge and vertex is only apart of this face
00553              * this lets us walk over the the boundary of an ngon which is handy */
00554             (owalk.is_boundary == TRUE && owalk.is_single == TRUE && vert_edge_tot == 2 && BM_edge_is_boundary(e)))
00555         {
00556             i = 0;
00557             stopi = vert_edge_tot / 2;
00558             while (1) {
00559                 if ((owalk.is_boundary == FALSE) && (i == stopi)) {
00560                     break;
00561                 }
00562 
00563                 l = BM_face_other_edge_loop(l->f, l->e, v);
00564 
00565                 if (l == NULL) {
00566                     break;
00567                 }
00568                 else {
00569                     BMLoop *l_next;
00570 
00571                     l_next = l->radial_next;
00572 
00573                     if ((l_next == l) || (l_next == NULL)) {
00574                         break;
00575                     }
00576 
00577                     l = l_next;
00578                     i++;
00579                 }
00580             }
00581         }
00582 
00583         if (l != NULL) {
00584             if (l != e->l &&
00585                 bmw_mask_check_edge(walker, l->e) &&
00586                 !BLI_ghash_haskey(walker->visithash, l->e))
00587             {
00588                 if (!(owalk.is_boundary == FALSE && i != stopi)) {
00589                     lwalk = BMW_state_add(walker);
00590                     lwalk->cur = l->e;
00591                     lwalk->lastv = v;
00592 
00593                     lwalk->is_boundary = owalk.is_boundary;
00594                     lwalk->is_single = owalk.is_single;
00595                     lwalk->f_hub = owalk.f_hub;
00596 
00597                     BLI_ghash_insert(walker->visithash, l->e, NULL);
00598                 }
00599             }
00600         }
00601     }
00602     else {  /* WIRE EDGE */
00603         BMIter eiter;
00604 
00605         /* match trunk: mark all connected wire edges */
00606         for (i = 0; i < 2; i++) {
00607             v = i ? e->v2 : e->v1;
00608 
00609             BM_ITER_ELEM (nexte, &eiter, v, BM_EDGES_OF_VERT) {
00610                 if ((nexte->l == NULL) &&
00611                     bmw_mask_check_edge(walker, nexte) &&
00612                     !BLI_ghash_haskey(walker->visithash, nexte))
00613                 {
00614                     lwalk = BMW_state_add(walker);
00615                     lwalk->cur = nexte;
00616                     lwalk->lastv = v;
00617 
00618                     lwalk->is_boundary = owalk.is_boundary;
00619                     lwalk->is_single = owalk.is_single;
00620                     lwalk->f_hub = owalk.f_hub;
00621 
00622                     BLI_ghash_insert(walker->visithash, nexte, NULL);
00623                 }
00624             }
00625         }
00626     }
00627 
00628     return owalk.cur;
00629 }
00630 
00639 /* Check whether the face loop should includes the face specified
00640  * by the given BMLoop */
00641 static int bmw_FaceLoopWalker_include_face(BMWalker *walker, BMLoop *l)
00642 {
00643     /* face must have degree 4 */
00644     if (l->f->len != 4) {
00645         return FALSE;
00646     }
00647 
00648     if (!bmw_mask_check_face(walker, l->f)) {
00649         return FALSE;
00650     }
00651 
00652     /* the face must not have been already visite */
00653     if (BLI_ghash_haskey(walker->visithash, l->f) && BLI_ghash_haskey(walker->secvisithash, l->e)) {
00654         return FALSE;
00655     }
00656 
00657     return TRUE;
00658 }
00659 
00660 /* Check whether the face loop can start from the given edge */
00661 static int bmw_FaceLoopWalker_edge_begins_loop(BMWalker *walker, BMEdge *e)
00662 {
00663     /* There is no face loop starting from a wire edge */
00664     if (BM_edge_is_wire(e)) {
00665         return FALSE;
00666     }
00667     
00668     /* Don't start a loop from a boundary edge if it cannot
00669      * be extended to cover any faces */
00670     if (BM_edge_is_boundary(e)) {
00671         if (!bmw_FaceLoopWalker_include_face(walker, e->l)) {
00672             return FALSE;
00673         }
00674     }
00675     
00676     /* Don't start a face loop from non-manifold edges */
00677     if (!BM_edge_is_manifold(e)) {
00678         return FALSE;
00679     }
00680 
00681     return TRUE;
00682 }
00683 
00684 static void bmw_FaceLoopWalker_begin(BMWalker *walker, void *data)
00685 {
00686     BMwFaceLoopWalker *lwalk, owalk;
00687     BMEdge *e = data;
00688     /* BMesh *bm = walker->bm; */ /* UNUSED */
00689     /* int fcount = BM_edge_face_count(e); */ /* UNUSED */
00690 
00691     if (!bmw_FaceLoopWalker_edge_begins_loop(walker, e))
00692         return;
00693 
00694     lwalk = BMW_state_add(walker);
00695     lwalk->l = e->l;
00696     lwalk->nocalc = 0;
00697     BLI_ghash_insert(walker->visithash, lwalk->l->f, NULL);
00698 
00699     /* rewin */
00700     while (BMW_current_state(walker)) {
00701         owalk = *((BMwFaceLoopWalker *)BMW_current_state(walker));
00702         BMW_walk(walker);
00703     }
00704 
00705     lwalk = BMW_state_add(walker);
00706     *lwalk = owalk;
00707     lwalk->nocalc = 0;
00708 
00709     BLI_ghash_free(walker->secvisithash, NULL, NULL);
00710     walker->secvisithash = BLI_ghash_new(BLI_ghashutil_ptrhash, BLI_ghashutil_ptrcmp, "bmesh walkers 3");
00711     BLI_ghash_insert(walker->visithash, lwalk->l->e, NULL);
00712 
00713     BLI_ghash_free(walker->visithash, NULL, NULL);
00714     walker->visithash = BLI_ghash_new(BLI_ghashutil_ptrhash, BLI_ghashutil_ptrcmp, "bmesh walkers 3");
00715     BLI_ghash_insert(walker->visithash, lwalk->l->f, NULL);
00716 }
00717 
00718 static void *bmw_FaceLoopWalker_yield(BMWalker *walker)
00719 {
00720     BMwFaceLoopWalker *lwalk = BMW_current_state(walker);
00721     
00722     if (!lwalk) {
00723         return NULL;
00724     }
00725 
00726     return lwalk->l->f;
00727 }
00728 
00729 static void *bmw_FaceLoopWalker_step(BMWalker *walker)
00730 {
00731     BMwFaceLoopWalker *lwalk = BMW_current_state(walker);
00732     BMFace *f = lwalk->l->f;
00733     BMLoop *l = lwalk->l, *origl = lwalk->l;
00734 
00735     BMW_state_remove(walker);
00736 
00737     l = l->radial_next;
00738     
00739     if (lwalk->nocalc) {
00740         return f;
00741     }
00742 
00743     if (!bmw_FaceLoopWalker_include_face(walker, l)) {
00744         l = lwalk->l;
00745         l = l->next->next;
00746         if (!BM_edge_is_manifold(l->e)) {
00747             l = l->prev->prev;
00748         }
00749         l = l->radial_next;
00750     }
00751 
00752     if (bmw_FaceLoopWalker_include_face(walker, l)) {
00753         lwalk = BMW_state_add(walker);
00754         lwalk->l = l;
00755 
00756         if (l->f->len != 4) {
00757             lwalk->nocalc = 1;
00758             lwalk->l = origl;
00759         }
00760         else {
00761             lwalk->nocalc = 0;
00762         }
00763 
00764         BLI_ghash_insert(walker->secvisithash, l->e, NULL);
00765         BLI_ghash_insert(walker->visithash, l->f, NULL);
00766     }
00767 
00768     return f;
00769 }
00770 
00771 // #define BMW_EDGERING_NGON
00772 
00780 static void bmw_EdgeringWalker_begin(BMWalker *walker, void *data)
00781 {
00782     BMwEdgeringWalker *lwalk, owalk;
00783     BMEdge *e = data;
00784 
00785     lwalk = BMW_state_add(walker);
00786     lwalk->l = e->l;
00787 
00788     if (!lwalk->l) {
00789         lwalk->wireedge = e;
00790         return;
00791     }
00792     else {
00793         lwalk->wireedge = NULL;
00794     }
00795 
00796     BLI_ghash_insert(walker->visithash, lwalk->l->e, NULL);
00797 
00798     /* rewin */
00799     while (BMW_current_state(walker)) {
00800         owalk = *((BMwEdgeringWalker *)BMW_current_state(walker));
00801         BMW_walk(walker);
00802     }
00803 
00804     lwalk = BMW_state_add(walker);
00805     *lwalk = owalk;
00806 
00807 #ifdef BMW_EDGERING_NGON
00808     if (lwalk->l->f->len % 2 != 0)
00809 #else
00810     if (lwalk->l->f->len != 4)
00811 #endif
00812     {
00813         lwalk->l = lwalk->l->radial_next;
00814     }
00815 
00816     BLI_ghash_free(walker->visithash, NULL, NULL);
00817     walker->visithash = BLI_ghash_new(BLI_ghashutil_ptrhash, BLI_ghashutil_ptrcmp, "bmesh walkers 4");
00818     BLI_ghash_insert(walker->visithash, lwalk->l->e, NULL);
00819 }
00820 
00821 static void *bmw_EdgeringWalker_yield(BMWalker *walker)
00822 {
00823     BMwEdgeringWalker *lwalk = BMW_current_state(walker);
00824     
00825     if (!lwalk) {
00826         return NULL;
00827     }
00828 
00829     if (lwalk->l) {
00830         return lwalk->l->e;
00831     }
00832     else {
00833         return lwalk->wireedge;
00834     }
00835 }
00836 
00837 static void *bmw_EdgeringWalker_step(BMWalker *walker)
00838 {
00839     BMwEdgeringWalker *lwalk = BMW_current_state(walker);
00840     BMEdge *e, *wireedge = lwalk->wireedge;
00841     BMLoop *l = lwalk->l , *origl = lwalk->l;
00842 #ifdef BMW_EDGERING_NGON
00843     int i, len;
00844 #endif
00845 
00846 #define EDGE_CHECK(e) (bmw_mask_check_edge(walker, e) && (BM_edge_is_boundary(e) || BM_edge_is_manifold(e)))
00847 
00848     BMW_state_remove(walker);
00849 
00850     if (!l)
00851         return wireedge;
00852 
00853     e = l->e;
00854     if (!EDGE_CHECK(e)) {
00855         /* walker won't traverse to a non-manifold edge, but may
00856          * be started on one, and should not traverse *away* from
00857          * a non-manfold edge (non-manifold edges are never in an
00858          * edge ring with manifold edges */
00859         return e;
00860     }
00861 
00862 #ifdef BMW_EDGERING_NGON
00863     l = l->radial_next;
00864 
00865     i = len = l->f->len;
00866     while (i > 0) {
00867         l = l->next;
00868         i -= 2;
00869     }
00870 
00871     if ((len <= 0) || (len % 2 != 0) || !EDGE_CHECK(l->e) ||
00872         !bmw_mask_check_face(walker, l->f))
00873     {
00874         l = origl;
00875         i = len;
00876         while (i > 0) {
00877             l = l->next;
00878             i -= 2;
00879         }
00880     }
00881     /* only walk to manifold edge */
00882     if ((l->f->len % 2 == 0) && EDGE_CHECK(l->e) &&
00883         !BLI_ghash_haskey(walker->visithash, l->e)) 
00884 
00885 #else
00886 
00887     l = l->radial_next;
00888     l = l->next->next;
00889     
00890     if ((l->f->len != 4) || !EDGE_CHECK(l->e) || !bmw_mask_check_face(walker, l->f)) {
00891         l = origl->next->next;
00892     }
00893     /* only walk to manifold edge */
00894     if ((l->f->len == 4) && EDGE_CHECK(l->e) &&
00895         !BLI_ghash_haskey(walker->visithash, l->e))
00896 #endif
00897     {
00898         lwalk = BMW_state_add(walker);
00899         lwalk->l = l;
00900         lwalk->wireedge = NULL;
00901 
00902         BLI_ghash_insert(walker->visithash, l->e, NULL);
00903     }
00904 
00905     return e;
00906 
00907 #undef EDGE_CHECK
00908 }
00909 
00910 static void bmw_UVEdgeWalker_begin(BMWalker *walker, void *data)
00911 {
00912     BMwUVEdgeWalker *lwalk;
00913     BMLoop *l = data;
00914 
00915     if (BLI_ghash_haskey(walker->visithash, l))
00916         return;
00917 
00918     lwalk = BMW_state_add(walker);
00919     lwalk->l = l;
00920     BLI_ghash_insert(walker->visithash, l, NULL);
00921 }
00922 
00923 static void *bmw_UVEdgeWalker_yield(BMWalker *walker)
00924 {
00925     BMwUVEdgeWalker *lwalk = BMW_current_state(walker);
00926     
00927     if (!lwalk) {
00928         return NULL;
00929     }
00930 
00931     return lwalk->l;
00932 }
00933 
00934 static void *bmw_UVEdgeWalker_step(BMWalker *walker)
00935 {
00936     BMwUVEdgeWalker *lwalk = BMW_current_state(walker);
00937     BMLoop *l, *l2, *l3, *nl, *cl;
00938     BMIter liter;
00939     void *d1, *d2;
00940     int i, j, rlen, type;
00941 
00942     l = lwalk->l;
00943     nl = l->next;
00944     type = walker->bm->ldata.layers[walker->layer].type;
00945 
00946     BMW_state_remove(walker);
00947 
00948     if (!bmw_mask_check_edge(walker, l->e)) {
00949         return l;
00950     }
00951 
00952     /* go over loops around l->v and nl->v and see which ones share l and nl's
00953      * mloopuv's coordinates. in addition, push on l->next if necessary */
00954     for (i = 0; i < 2; i++) {
00955         cl = i ? nl : l;
00956         BM_ITER_ELEM (l2, &liter, cl->v, BM_LOOPS_OF_VERT) {
00957             d1 = CustomData_bmesh_get_layer_n(&walker->bm->ldata,
00958                                               cl->head.data, walker->layer);
00959             
00960             rlen = BM_edge_face_count(l2->e);
00961             for (j = 0; j < rlen; j++) {
00962                 if (BLI_ghash_haskey(walker->visithash, l2)) {
00963                     continue;
00964                 }
00965 
00966                 if (!bmw_mask_check_edge(walker, l2->e)) {
00967                     if (l2->v != cl->v) {
00968                         continue;
00969                     }
00970                 }
00971 
00972                 l3 = l2->v != cl->v ? l2->next : l2;
00973                 d2 = CustomData_bmesh_get_layer_n(&walker->bm->ldata,
00974                                                   l3->head.data, walker->layer);
00975 
00976                 if (!CustomData_data_equals(type, d1, d2))
00977                     continue;
00978                 
00979                 lwalk = BMW_state_add(walker);
00980                 BLI_ghash_insert(walker->visithash, l2, NULL);
00981 
00982                 lwalk->l = l2;
00983 
00984                 l2 = l2->radial_next;
00985             }
00986         }
00987     }
00988 
00989     return l;
00990 }
